intro: Agoseris aspera, commonly known as roughleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela, which are dispersed by wind. Agoseris aspera is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
